transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: Everyone, so the agenda for this meeting is discussing our new venture

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: which is related to tech product.

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: We won't be disclosing the name right now for compliance reasons, but

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: the idea basically is to have a store for our partners

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: partners. I mean, the delivery partner

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: who are serving food on our platform. So these partners will have

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: access to an internal shop, which will be

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: accessible through their own rider management platform.

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: And so they can click the link and go to the store

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: where they can pay directly from the wallet of the

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: writer itself. So they don't need to.

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: Do any UPI payment or card payments. They can just pay directly from the rider wallet.

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: And we will deduct the money from their wallet

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: and give them the item using our logistics service.

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: So, primarily, the agenda for this

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: meeting is discussing why do we need this feature. And so

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: we thought that it is important for writers to have

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: a source of, you know, marketplace

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: our platform itself. So they are earning money from our platform.

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: But they should also have a platform to spend some money

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: get their items that that they use from day to day

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: on our platform itself. So the items would include things like

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: charging cables, water bottles,

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: medicines, and stuff like that.

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: That can be purchased under five hundred rupees, thousand rupees, and

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: also can be paid from the RiderBotet, like,

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal
transcript.text: not too expensive. So this is the whole point of the

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal

transcript.speaker: Harsh Bansal

summary: The meeting discussed a new venture involving an internal store for delivery partners on the platform. This store will be accessible through the rider management platform, allowing partners to purchase items directly using funds from their rider wallets, avoiding the need for UPI or card payments. The money will be deducted from their wallets, and items will be delivered using the company's logistics service. The primary goal is to provide partners with a marketplace within the platform where they can spend money earned from the platform itself.
key_points: New venture: An internal store for delivery partners (riders) on the platform.
Access: The store will be accessible through the rider management platform.
Payment method: Riders can pay directly from their own wallets, with deductions made from their earnings.
Logistics: Items will be delivered using the company's logistics service.
Rationale: To provide riders with a marketplace to spend money earned on the platform.
